result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Satisfaction Mailed, Fee UNPAID ($5.00)

To cancel commitment

Failure to Pay Fine Due
Amended - $290 due in 30 days or 12 days KCJ - $250 for DNA F/C totals  $540.00
$705.00 ue in 30 days or 12 days KCJ or 12 days work crew.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney John German.  The DE plead guilty, found guilty.  $200.00 fine + costs, 30 days to pay or 12 days KCJ.  Bond on deposit of $500.00 to be applied.  Firearms warning given.  DNA p/w given to the DE.  Clerk D. Smith.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John German.  Ongoing negotiations; attempting to get the deft into Veteran's Court.  Mutual request for an adjournment.  FPT 11/9/15 @ 1:15pm, JS 11/30/15 @ 9am.  If the resolution of this case will require a probation sentence in order for the deft to be accepted into Veteran's Court, the court is not inclined to accept a plea bargain which will dictate the outcome of the case.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared (10 min late) in person w/Atty John German.  Defense has not received discovery yet; argn date was just a week ago.  Case was set quickly since the co-deft's case was on this afternoon as well.  Another FPT set for 10/9/15 @ 11:30am

Defendant, Patricia Ann Anderson, appeared with Attorney John E. German.  Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 3.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Per phone message, Atty John German has been retained by the def.  Atty German has a conflict with the AIA date of 8/25/15 at 1:00.  AIA reset for 9/3/15 at 1:00.

211pm  Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk: NJurgens.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Deft will retain his own counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.  Warrant vacated.  $500 cont'd posted  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Refund balance.
